intro: Dasyphyllum reticulatum var. robustum, commonly known as the robust dasyphyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, woody structure and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
